We applied the net CO 2–N 2O effect calculated with tropical, temperate, and boreal forest parameterizations to tropical, temperate, and boreal forest areas (from the 2015 Global Forest Resources Assessment
53 ) respectively. Many forests are recovering from a past disturbance, imparting a variegated age distribution on global forests
64 . Because the net CO 2–N 2O effect (Eqs. ( 9) and ( 10)) is averaged over the first 100 years of ecosystem succession, it roughly encompasses the age distribution of global forests.
